intro: Ficaria holubyi, commonly known as the Holub's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with numerous petals and a hairy stem. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
